response.answer_text: I think you might mean “fudenosuke” pens. A fudenosuke is a kind of Japanese pen that has a flexible pen tip, so it behaves somewhat like a brush. (“Fude” is the Japanse word for “brush”.) The thickness of the line varies with the pressure and stroke of the pen, so it’s useful for calligraphy, while being somewhat more convenient to use than an actual brush (and separate ink).
